Building a story from smaller interconnected stories can be a great way to structure a book and create a cohesive narrative. This approach can allow you to explore different themes and ideas through the perspectives of different characters, and it can also create opportunities for foreshadowing and other literary devices.

One thing to consider when using this structure is how to effectively link the stories together and how to reveal the connections between the characters in a way that is satisfying for the reader. It might be helpful to think about the overall arc of the book and how the smaller stories contribute to the development of the plot and themes.

It might also be helpful to consider the genre of the book and what conventions and expectations exist within that genre. For example, if you are writing a science fiction novel, readers may expect to see elements such as advanced technology and futuristic settings, while if you are writing a romance novel, readers may expect to see romantic relationships and character development.

how long my book should be and how many chapters ?

The length and number of chapters in a book can vary depending on the genre, style, and content of the book. There is no one-size-fits-all answer to how long a book should be or how many chapters it should have.

That being said, a general guideline for the length of a book is that it should be long enough to fully explore the ideas and themes that you want to present, but not so long that it becomes tedious or overwhelming for the reader. In general, a book that is between 50,000 and 80,000 words is a good length for most genres. However, some books may be shorter or longer depending on the needs of the story.

As for the number of chapters, this will depend on the length and structure of the book. Chapters are used to break up the text and provide a logical structure for the story. In general, chapters should be long enough to cover a significant event or development, but not so long that they become unwieldy or hard to follow. A good rule of thumb is to aim for chapters that are between 3,000 and 5,000 words in length. However, again, the exact length of chapters will depend on the needs of your book.

I hope this helps to give you a sense of the general guidelines for book length and chapter structure. Remember that these are just general guidelines and that the most important thing is to tell your story in a way that is engaging and satisfying for the reader.

how much world is one page in a book ?

The amount of text that fits on a single page of a book can vary depending on a number of factors, including the size of the book, the font size and type, and the margins. In general, a standard page of a novel contains around 250-300 words, but this can vary depending on the specific requirements of the book. For example, a book with a larger font size or wider margins may have fewer words per page, while a book with a smaller font size or narrower margins may have more words per page.

It is also worth noting that the concept of a "page" can be different in an electronic book (e-book) than in a physical book. In an e-book, the number of words per page may vary based on the device on which the book is being read and the settings chosen by the reader.

I hope this helps to give you a sense of the general guidelines for the number of words per page in a book. Remember that these are just rough estimates and that the most important thing is to present your text in a way that is clear, coherent, and easy to read for the reader.
